body: Note: the need for a tool like this is greater now that great datasets like SQuAD exist, because it's more practical to train your own models. Given the fact that you can fine-tune BERT on SQuAD, it'd be invaluable to have a resource that lets you build your own SQuAD-formatted dataset that is domain specific!

Thank you for the feature request! At first, please let me arrange the type of QA related dataset. Because there are many variations.

**Passage type**

1. Single-passage type: Only one passage is shown.
2. Multi-passage type: Multiple passages are shown.
   * QAngaroo,  HotpotQA, MultiRC etc
3. Multimedia passage type: Passage includes not only text, but also image etc.
   * VQA, FigureQA etc

**Answer type**

1. Extractive answer type: The answer is a span in a passage.
   * SQuAD, Maluuba News QA etc
2. Selective answer type: Select the answer from candidates.
   * AI2 Reasoning Challenge Dataset, FigureQA etc
3. Generative answer type: The answer is generated by a human.
   * MSMARCO V2, MilkQA etc

Fow now, you can use doccano in following situation.

* By Sequence to Sequence annotation feature
  * Passage type is 1 & Answer type is 3. (Show passage and question as annotation target).
* By Text Classificatioin feature
  * Passage type is 1 & Answer type is 2. (Show passage/question/choices as annotation target).

We want to decide from user feedback that what kind of QA dataset is appropriate to support.
So please send us your comments!

My use case is `1&1` -- SQuAD-like. 

The option for Passage-type 2 seems cool and achievable. The option for Passage-type 3 would be very cool, but seems like it requires turning doccano into a multimodal annotation tool (a great goal!) which feels farther off.

I could see wanting to eventually use any of the Answer-types, but I agree that it is definitely possible to set up Answer-types 2 & 3 with current functionality.

> My use case is `1&1` -- SQuAD-like.
> 
> The option for Passage-type 2 seems cool and achievable. The option for Passage-type 3 would be very cool, but seems like it requires turning doccano into a multimodal annotation tool (a great goal!) which feels farther off.
> 
> I could see wanting to eventually use any of the Answer-types, but I agree that it is definitely possible to set up Answer-types 2 & 3 with current functionality.

Any update about your question @jamesmf ? I am looking for the same thing: a way to reproduce SQuAD in another language...
@Hironsan @icoxfog417 Do you have any update on this topic? Is there a chance this feature request could be worked on within the end of the year?

There is no obvious plan for supporting QA. However, we are watching any reactions to issues. To measure community demand quantitatively, please vote up (push 👍 ) top of the issue (like following).

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/544269/59002288-dc835f80-884c-11e9-9c5a-6847c6f988a5.png)


## Back ground

We are preparing a roadmap of doccano to share the direction of development with our community. The developer's reactions (:thumbsup: etc) to feature request issues are an important clue for the roadmap (because of this, we are also making some experimental feature issues like #224).

Understood. I just did it, thanks
@icoxfog417
This feature is really important and urgent, I look forward to joining this feature, I will continue to pay attention to this feature.

issue.title: New project type: Question and answer

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
**Summary:**
This pull request has a simple objective: creating a new annotation mode, for the task "question and answer" 

Ref: #81 

**What changed**

- Backend: 2 models were created (_QandAProject_  & _QandAAnnotation_ ) and all the following related (serializer)
The model _Document_ was slightly modified, adding the text field called _extra_text_ - allows some tasks to store additional information, like a question for instance.
Migrations were created following the model changes as well
Questionable: the necessity of having QandAStorage. At the moment, I guess I could use _Seq2seqStorage_ instead.  

- Frontend: a new front was added using the component _download_qanda.vue_. Visual examples for uploading / downloading data were created as well.

**Other Info**
This is a Draft pull request at the moment. No tests were created yet, and it isn't merged with the latest master branch due to a problem with _pyodbc_ on my side

issue.title: Feature Request: Multiple choice question

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
Feature description
---------
Thanks for your tools, they have helped us a lot. I wonder if you will add support for multiple-choice annotations. Here is an example：
Question:
```
The capital of the China?
```
Options:
```
A. XXX
B. XXX
C. XXX
```
The number of opetions is not always the same for questions.
The user could select one option when annotation.

Currently we could use Seq2Seq annotation to do this but it is not so convenient.

body: Would love to see 2&2 supported, i.e. the display of multiple passages and one or more multiple-choice questions.
Hi all - Any update on this feature request? My current project involves Question And Answer  (Machine Comprehension) and would love to have a tool that has  SQUAD like feature. Thanks.

I wanted it as well, and started working on this feature a year ago here #304. After some time waiting for a merge, I switched to a dedicated QA fork of Doccano. Feel free to use and PR on this one https://github.com/etalab/piaf

Note : It is only for SQuAD like QA task. No NER, No doc classification. Big plus : it is designed to be used in collaborative annotation projects (anyone can sign-in)

> I wanted it as well, and started working on this feature a year ago here #304. After some time waiting for a merge, I switched to a dedicated QA fork of Doccano. Feel free to use and PR on this one https://github.com/etalab/piaf
> 
> Note : It is only for SQuAD like QA task. No NER, No doc classification. Big plus : it is designed to be used in collaborative annotation projects (anyone can sign-in)

Hi Guillim, thanks for pointing me to your tool for QnA. I could not get it to run on my Mac. I tried both with Docker and without.  Neither worked, I get a `TemplateDoesNotExist at /app/` error. It builds but with warnings and errors and then launches but does not launch the app, unfortunately. I was excited about this. 

Ozan
Please create an issue directly inside the Piaf github project (I don't want to spam Doccano users) and I'll be very happy to help you with it

issue.title: Improvement Idea for doccano

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
**Please read this issue when you want to add the feature to doccano**  
**Please upvote 👍 related issue that let us judge priority .**

We show 👍 if someone upvote, and 🤩 means over 10 vote

## Toward More Practical Annotation Tool

### Annotation

* Display
  - [ ] : Support HTML syntax in Document #35 👍
* Filter
  - [ ] : Arrange Annotation Status and Filter by it #280 👍
* Label
  - [ ] : Provide for setting the order of labels #816
  - [ ] : Group labels by the same color #477
  - [ ] : Support multiple kinds of label set #5 👍
  - [x] : Display shortkey in labels selector (on Annotation page) #834
* Annotation
  - [x] : keyboard shortcut for approval button #718 👍
  - [x] : A button to clear the markup. #631
  - [ ] : Automatically select the sequential characters in the sequence labeling task by the hover. #666
  - [ ] : Show context when annotation. #466 
* Navigation
  - [x] : Redirect to the specific page by id, not by offset. #540 👍
  - [x] : "First" and "Last" buttons #615
* Productivity
  - [ ] : Display the who annotated the document #881
  - [x] : Support Comments when Annotating #1050
  - [ ] : Enable Stats view for non-admins #270 👍
* Portability
  - [ ] : Project export and import #901

### Dataset

* Import/Export
  - [x] : Convert label to label-ID when exporting #295 🤩
  - [x] : Import the exported annotation data and keep the all original info #482
  - [x] : Support JSON format (not JSONL) #454 👍
  - [x] : Make maximum file upload (import) size configurable #708 👍
* Management
  - [x] : Bulk Delete #523

## Toward Advanced Annotation Tool

### Task

- [ ] : Question Answering dataset #81 🤩
- [ ] : Multiple choice question #464
- [x] : Multiple label in sequence labeling #19 🤩
- [x] : Nested Named Entity Recognition #544 👍
- [x] : Relation Annotation #233 👍

### Auto-Annotation

- [ ] : Implements labeling functions (Weak Supervision) #224 🤩
- [x] : Add Auto-labeling #191

## Toward Production Usage

* Deployment
  - [ ] : Helm chart #701 👍
  - [x] : Support doccano v1.x on Heroku #811
* Security
  - [ ] :  [Proposal] Warn and/or fail if default admin's password hasn't been changed #857
  - [x] : Clarify how to set user own username/password in docker-compose for security #748
* Authentication
  - [ ] : Two factor authentication for admin and annotators #756
  - [ ] : Okta OIDC social login is not available #1255 👍
  - [ ] : Google OAuth support #620 👍
  - [ ] : LDAP-Support #560 👍
* Annotation Workflow
  - [x] : Allow user to change another users' annotation #531 👍
* Annotator Management
  - [ ] : Allow to assign more than one role in a project. #537
  - [ ] : Enhance Statistics: Compare Annotators #114 👍
* Accessibility
  - [x] : Multiple language interface #479

issue.title: Add support for Question Answering labeling

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body: Question Answering is a common NLP task. It would be great if doccano can support Question Answering labeling.
